description: A back-formation from injury, from Anglo-Norman injurie, from Latin iniūria (“injustice; wrong; offense”), from in- (“not”) + iūs, iūris (“right, law”).

verbs.description: injure (third-person singular simple present injures, present participle injuring, simple past and past participle injured)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To wound or cause physical harm to a living creature.
examples: The rugby team's star player got injured in a violent collision.
I injured my ankle playing tennis.
